Reviews.Title: “4 nights in Rome could have been better”
Reviews.Author: lucky817
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 4 night stay in Rome following a 4 night stay in Paris, and we had the unpleasent experience staying at this hotel. To begin with, I'm not usually one to write reviews (I read a lot of them but don't usually write them) but I decided to do so after staying here. First I'll start with the stuff that was actually good about the hotel: Rooftop Garden Terrace - the garden terrace on the 4th floor is actually very nice. There is wi-fi on the terrace (but not in the rooms) so my wife and I would get some Italian beer at a little market store about 2 or 3 doors down (really cheap, only 1.40 Euros for a 40 ounce bottle that most restaurants in the area charge 5 to 7 Euros for the same bottle) and relax, check our emails, etc. Market Store - There is a little market store (looks more like a butcher shop with fresh meats, etc, but they sell cheap soft drinks, water, and beer/wine and some snacks) that came in handy for a quick, cheap drink or snack since the hotel doesn't provide anything. And now for the bad: Room and Bed - The location is ok, it is a 5 minute walk from the Vatican walls and 10 minute walk fromt he nearest metro stop, but the street and surrounding neighborhood doesn't exactly feel safe. The bed is the WORST I have ever slept on! It is rock hard, almost like sleeping on a yoga mat or something. The weather was beautiful 70's during the day, low 60s at night, however for some reason the room would still get very warm with the window closed. When you open the window, the noise from the trucks and moter scooters zipping down the road echo off the walls of the buildings and into your room with an annoying roar. Window open with noise, or window closed with sweating at night....I didn't want to chose between the worser of two evils, so I went down and asked about air conditioning. I was proceeded to feel like an idiot by the desk manager because I asked for A/C before the month of June. However, after continuing to push the issue, he said it's thier policy to charge 10 Euros per night for A/C. So be it! But the desk manager could have been nicer about it. He was making it out like it was the BIG chore to have someone bring me the A/C remote controller to turn it on. Key - The hotel gives you one key that has a big, awkward paperweight attached that you must return to the front desk before leaving and retrive when returning everytime you leave the hotel. It sometimes became a chore, especially when only one of us was leaving and the other was in the room. I understand that the hotel wants to keep thier rooms safe, especially since the hotel shares the building with some other company, but they could invest in the new card key technology that most hotels use now-a-days. Shower - The rooms are actually very spacious for European hotel rooms, however the bathroom shower is very small. So small that the shower door was cracked from when a previous occupant must have put a knee or arm through it trying to wash themselves. The waterpressure was very nice, but the water would switch from warm to SCOLDING hot without warning. Service - There were three desk managers that we saw during our stay, and two of them were very nice and helpful, but one was very rude and would always just try and shoo me away quickly when I had questions/concerns. I understand there is a language barrier and it can be difficult and sometimes fustrationg to speak a non-native language to tourists, but to be rude to your customers and show that you don't really have a concern about their requests/needs is not the way to make them feel welcome. Overall, Rome is a wonderful place bursting with history and charm, but it can be somewhat confusing and difficult to navigate, and usually your hotel is your "home base" that you can feel safe and obtain info to make your trip easier, but don't expect that at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stopped in Rome for 2 nights---2 single Female/NYC”
Reviews.Author: Babyleo726
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Rome for 2 nights on our quick 7 night Italy trip. Found this hotel on orbitz.com $112USD for 2 night--good price. I read the reviews on tripadvisor and then booked the cheap rate on orbitz. *** Location: great!!! We opted to take a taxi from FCO airport for about $20Euro each but honestly if you are looking to save then you can take a train from FCO to Termini(Main train station in Rome). THen take the A line metro ($1Euro) and get out at Octavia stop. From the metro stop its about a 12 min walk. Not so bad. The hotel is about a 5 min walk to St. Peters/Vatican----great location. *** Room: Free wifi on the 4th floor only, which again---its free so who cares right? THe 4th floor offers a beautiful solarium or outdoor garden with ivy fence/table/chairs. Very pretty----amazing sunset view but honestly the best sunset view in Rome was at the Vittoriano. You must go there for a sunset view. We had a room on the 4th floor and 1st floor. The first floor had a small balcony---cute. Clean room, showers. No complaints. Again for what we paid and what we really did in the room(sleep only) it was a bargain----I recommend this room to anyone who is truly there to visit Rome and be out all day. If you need fridge in the room, doorman, cafeteria in the hotel, feather pillows then this place is not for you. Again---we paid appx $30pp USD = ) *** Front desk: the 2 men who work there were excellent!!!!!!! Gave us a cool map and circled places to visit and eat. Great service--thank you. **** WALKING DISTANCE **** Again we are from NY...where walking is 2nd nature to us. We literally walked everywhere....from the colosseum to the hotel is about 1hr or so. But we made so many stops on the way as there is alot to see in Rome. One night we were tired-----hung out at the spanish steps which was very cool and took the metro home ( I think they close around 12am). So worth the $1Euro. There are buses near the Octavia metro stop for $1 Euro and they are ok, just alot of traffic. Just remember to ride the buses you must buy a ticket at a cafe/shop-----you cant jump on and pay the driver (nyc mind lol). Enjoy Rome

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Jessica C
Reviews.Content: Location: Just 2 minutes away from Castel Sant' Angelo and 5 mins from St. Peter's Basilica. Quiet and safe area connected to the centre by bus no. 40. Bus stop is just around the corner from the hotel. There is also a grocery shop nearby and a few places where you can have a coffee or a snack. Room, service and cleanliness: We had a triple room which was nicely decorated, quite spacious and with a good-sized bathroom. Our room was on the 4th floor. It was a very quiet hotel but we could still hear some traffic noise. No breakfast or coffee-making facilities were available. These are the only 2 faults I could find. Other than that, staff were helpful and available 24/7, rooms were clean and towels were changed everyday. A good number of plugs were available to charge our phones and cameras. We were also loaned an adapter. There is also a nice terrace on the 4th floor. In terms of value, the hotel was good value for money - we paid 321 euros (exc. city tax) for 4 nights for a triple room. You can also leave your luggage for the rest of the day after check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but good roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: Jen L
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel seemed ok, but it is basic. The location and roof terrace were good, but there were no services for making yourself a coffee in the room, or for paying for one within the hotel, which was annoying. I would recommend taking a travel kettle if you like a coffee or tea to wake you up before leaving the hotel in the morning. As we were there for 5 days, I would probably prefer to find a hotel with a few more basic facilities next time, but that's just me. Overall the staff were friendly, it's easy to walk everywhere, and having a roof terrace to chill out on with a bottle of wine after a day exploring was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dids84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights over new year. We would highly recommend staying here, dont forget its a 2 star hotel so dont be expecting the red carpet! however it was clean and had everything we needed. The room was cleaned daily, had a comforty bed, TV and the reception staff were pleasent and helpful. It was perfect the location is excellent just 2 blocks from St. Peters and a very short stroll to the city. If you book you ont be disappointed. We ate at the restaurant across the road to the left of the hotel and would recommend there, beautiful pizza and always busy ! Also its worth booking jump the queue tickets for the vatican as the queue's were like nothing ive seen before sooooo long if you were paying at the door! (we booked online with the company dark Rome) . We also ate at the Restaurant AD Hoc (look online) the service was the best ive ever had and food super, we booked online before we went and saw many people get turned away at the door as they were full. Enjoy Rome its amazing.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent 2 star hotel,”
Reviews.Author: Apostolis_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 10 nights in a single room, which was more than comfortable. Has all the basic for someone who doesn't care about breakfast, safety boxes etc. Very clean, and a absolutely decent bathroom. In a perfect location, everything is near or on foot or by public transportations (subway-metro, buses). Places to eat or buy food also reachable on foot. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pro's outweigh the Con's”
Reviews.Author: Cirkz
Reviews.Content: This hotel would get 5 stars for location, but it is very basic and you should not expect it to be anything more than a room to sleep in. Pros: Location Lift Free Wifi (only works on top floor) Good shower Price Cons: Miserable staff No breakfast TV that does not work (though this was not an issue) Air con charged at 10 Euros per day No Fridge No Safe Slightly dirty

Reviews.Title: “Pretty basic, good location”
Reviews.Author: ranger1958
Reviews.Content: Basic, clean room. Nice to have a small balcony. Good location for visiting Vatican and not a far walk to other sites across the river. Front desk person was very nice and helpful. Bus stop to catch bus to train station is close by - very convenient. We only stayed 1 night but no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: SIGNALS123
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. Less than five minute walk to St. Peter's and Vacitan Museum. The room was clean, it was a little on the small side. The terrace on the fourth floor provided open space to enjoy wifi access. There is a small coffee shop across the street that is more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: NottsLoubylou
Reviews.Content: The Staff were very helpful throughout our 6 day stay. The room was very clean and ideal for us. The location could not have been better, we were close to all the places we planned to visit. I would not hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Tt's about it.”
Reviews.Author: Jia17
Reviews.Content: The location is prefect becos it is only a 3mins walk to Vatican museum and 2streets away from the Vatican! The are many small, cosy and very local restorante along the small alleys. Room wise, it is really really basic. Don't expect much.

Reviews.Title: “Patio Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Jim C
Reviews.Content: Odd place, with lobby/check-in desk upstairs on first floor. Room is, well, just a room. No frills. Bed, sheets, covers. And a bathroom. Clean and safe, I'd recommend this place and would stay here again. No breakfast or coffee. Best thing about it: the patio garden on the fourth floor. Very relaxing spot in the morning and evenings to unwind. Wifi on the patio, too. Also great location if you're going to the Vatican. About 3 blocks away. About six blocks from Ottaviano Metro Station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Karebear85
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect location for the Vatican. If you are planning on going reserve your spot ahead of time so you don't have to wait in line to buy tickets and get in. It was a bit far from other sights in Rome, but we found the buses and subways easy to navigate and we managed to find all of the spots we wanted to see. The area gets quiet early and it was difficult to find a restaurant for dinner close by. The restaurant recommended by the hotel was excellent, I loved my pasta! Overall the hotel was clean and conveniant and basic with nothing particularly impressive, but nothing bad to say. Air conditioning was expensive, 10EUR a night, which we chose not to pay. The room was warm, and the nights were very noisy, but this is to be expected in Rome with windows open. The staff was helpful with directions and places to go. There was wireless internet that didn't work in the rooms, and got okay reception on the Terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Duchess76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adriatic hotel for 8 nights in May. The location was excellent and we were able to walk to everything in the historic centre of Rome. I had emailed the hotel prior to our arrival to request a spacious room due to the length of our stay as well as a large bed. They were most accommodating. We were given a large corner room (the biggest European room we have ever stayed in) and the bed was a 'king', which seemed to be in between a North American king and queen in size. The room was immaculate. We also really enjoyed the roof garden area. There were several small supermarkets in close proximity which was really handy as there was no breakfast. For a 2 star hotel, we felt this was a phenomenal value. We stay at 5 star hotels in the Caribbean and usually 3-4 star hotels in Europe and the UK, but would definitely go back to this little 2 star gem again.

Reviews.Title: “Quad Room, Very Small, Clean”
Reviews.Author: Sam12335
Reviews.Content: Staff spoke excellent English, but were not overly knowledgeable about attractions. Front desk does not have a computer to assist you with questions and plans. We found an information booth next to the Castle Saint Angelo, a few blocks from the hotel (2 days into our stay) which ended up being very helpful. We highly recommend speaking with someone knowledgeable (i.e. information booth) about how to bypass long lines at attractions such as the coliseum. We used the Roma pass at the coliseum and had no wait at all...the general admission line seemed to be at least 2-hour wait. Get to St. Peters at 8:00 for no lines. It seems that the Vatican Museum/Sistine Chapel has lines early in the morning but not late morning or lunchtime.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location & great price however noisy room”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_Oz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Rome for 3 nights at Adriatic Hotel (EUR$65 plus service tax). Location is perfect (5 mins walk to Vatican city) and was a blessing when we timed out Vatican city day with the Rome transportation strike (occurs 2-3 times a month - recommend checking for planned strikes before you leave for Rome). We walked into the museum at 11am without having to queue. Staff weren't very friendly but did answer any questions we had. We knew about the EUR$10 air-condition fee per night and decided to leave the windows open. It was very noisy during the night and could be an issue if you're not use to street noise. We were exhausted most nights and just passed out. Be aware, there is an additional charge of EUR$2 per night per person for service tax which isn't included in the room rate. They did take our passports for the duration of our stay. He did give us an option to take them back however we decided to leave them at reception since we didn't have a safe in the room. Reception is open 24 hours a day. PRO: - Price for location (10 min walk to Vatican City entrance or nearest Metro) - Spacious, comfortable and clean room - 24 hour reception - Safe to walk around at night - Small cafes around the street - Free WiFi CON: - No breakfast - Noisy street if windows left open - EUR$10 fee per night for aircon - No safe in room - Staff aren't the friendliest bunch SUMMARY: Any budget young adult couples who are looking for something that is cheap, clean and safe with a central location then I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Grumpy staff, poor rooms, not very good value”
Reviews.Author: smcgra11
Reviews.Content: As the title said, chipped furniture, broken tvs, had to pay 40Euro for air con (which we declined!) Staff were not very polite and not very helpful. Nice roof terrace though. and they have WiFi. There are definitely better value places though. If you do stay round about here there is a lovely wee cobbled street with lots of restaurants and cafes behind here - definitely worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “i dont even know what to say...”
Reviews.Author: WanderingKaat
Reviews.Content: this is probably the worse hotel ive been to in my life. ive travelled elsewhere on a budget but the hotels weve been to were not as horrible as this. i know weve paid so little for this hotel but such wasnt the value we got from our hotel in spain, which was so much more beautiful. first up, the rooms did not have AC and you had to pay 10euro a day for AC. closing the windows would not even help, because with the intense heat in rome, you'd probably die in heat exhaustion. second, the tv was so small (one of those analogue tvs) and was positioned on top of a closet. what made it worse was the fact that our tv was broken and the staff didnt take any effort to fix it (all we got was a promise to fix it and on the next day, we were told "theres nothing we can do about it.") third, there were bugs of some sort that bit my daughter. i dont think those were bed bugs (hopefully, not) but my daughter ended up with 2 swellings from bug bites. fourth, i still have to understand why the owner/staff held on to our passports when we checked in. i know they are supposed to check it but not hang on to it (the statement we got was : its safer to leave your passports here with us rather than bringing it with you.) of course, we had no intention to take it with us, but we had no intention to leave it at the front desk, either, where it is not safe and locked. also, a passport is one's identity, so go figure my paranoia and hesitation. thus, i wont be surprised if something comes up in europe involving my identity, esp after this bad review. also, the night before we left, we had called the front desk to ask if they took credit cards for the city tax payment and the AC. the guy had said yes, only to be told the next morning they didnt take cards for the city tax payment. also, that night, we had asked for a car service to the airport and were told we could do that the day we fly out and, again, only to be told by another staff (or was it the owner?) that we should have booked it the day before. talk about inconsistencies. internet was free but slow. ok, in fairness, the upside to this hotel is its LOCATION. very convenient. just 3-4 blocks away from the vatican, about the same distance to the castel sant' angelo, about a mile walk to piazza navona and the pantheon. also, the solarium is a great place to hang out, so long as the weather permits (it gets too hot in the day).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Price”
Reviews.Author: blackrose_222
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon, and absolutely loved it. We were in Rome for 10 days, and then went to the Amalfi Coast for 7 days. Our hotel in Amalfi was rated 4 stars, and the Adriatic was WAY better. Fantastic location, as it is within walking distance of so many things. No issues at all, and the staff were very friendly... and work long hours. The wireless was a bit of trouble, as it only works outside the rooms - but not a big deal, as we were using a Laptop anyways. We would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad hotel near Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Marassa
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in May. The hotel is not bad, conveniently located, funnily shares a couple of adjacent buildings with private apartments accessible from the same staircase, the reception desk being somehow halfway between ground and 1st floor. Neither breakfast nor minibar is available. The room was not small, comfy bed, pillows a bit too hard to my taste. Free and reliable WiFi in the room requires a password you get from the reception staff. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Us”
Reviews.Author: Caperman
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 with two teens stayed here the night before a cruise. The hotel is in a great location as mentioned. Only a few blocks to the Vatican and there are lots of shops and restaurants nearby. The room was small but handled all of us easily. One double bed and 2 singles. The bathroom was clean and spacious. Overall a pleasant place to stay and If we ever return to Rome we would certainly try to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice solarium, close to the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Helard
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, very close to the Vatican, just 3 blocks away, so you can visit it at night without the crowds. A little far from metro station, but this is probably due to lack of metro lines in Rome (only two, soon to be three, but apparently every time they start digging a new metro line, they find more ruins!). Close to many small restaurants and a supermarket where you can get some groceries as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Susiepepper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adriatic over Easter 2011. The location is right in the middle between the Vatican and Castel San Angelo, just 10 minutes to either place. Remembering this is a 2 star hotel so it isn't glitzy, the room was very comfortable, safe, very clean, great shower and bathroom with fresh towels each day. Basically everything necessary was catered for.

Reviews.Title: “best location, nice neightbourhood”
Reviews.Author: bassamontagna
Reviews.Content: 5 min walk from St. Peters Square and Castel San Angelo. Nice but small room with rinovated bathroom. If they add breakfast, it would be ideally!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and helpful”
Reviews.Author: carmelita67
Reviews.Content: I traveled with children aged 10 and 14 and my elderly father. The hotel was easy to find ( number 40 bus from Termini, through a walled archway and you can see the sign post for hotel just ahead, the hotel just a few meters further on ). There was a lift but you had to walk down just a few steps to the reception area on the first floor. As soon as we checked in the Gentleman gave us a street map, circled all the most popular landmarks and told us where to get the bus from. I didn't realise how close every thing was. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and well decorated for a budget hotel. The beds were made and towels changed daily.We were on the fourth floor with access to the really nice roof garden. The hotel was easy walking distance to St Peters square, Castle Sant Angelo, restaurants, coffee shops,a mini-market, a wonderful deli, gift shops,designer shops, buses , trams and the metro!. We had a really enjoyable stay, all the staff that we met were very friendly and helpful and we would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great position and good value”
Reviews.Author: paul409
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights stay in Rome. What a excellent position to stay in Rome Vatican on doorstep and easy access to all other attractions. Hotel is clean and very comfortable rooms. Good service from reception staff. Beds changed twice on our stay and clean towels every day. Only shame no breakfast room. But excellent cafe across road serving great coffee and cakes at reasonable prices. Also excellent local family run restaurant also across road next to cafe called Porto Castello. Would recommend this hotel for value and position and would book again.

Reviews.Title: “great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: akp_va
Reviews.Content: For $50 dollars in the heart of Rome I was pleasantly pleased with the location, staff and room. My room was small but it had a balcony and a large bathroom. Only a few blocks from the Vatican and the metro line. Great for someone who doesn't want to spend a lot of time or money at their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence Choise”
Reviews.Author: joseharley
Reviews.Content: I select this hotel base on Trip Advisor. Location is perfect, close to St Angelo's Castle, and St Peter's Square. If you looking for an excellence price and location this is the place. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Free internet at the Lobby.

Reviews.Title: “True money - great location”
Reviews.Author: Serhiy_Vagabond
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in March 2010. Small but nice room. Bath should be completed with more powerful vent engine. Totally, good enough for money value and excellent to reach Vatican and St. Angel. Staff is friendly. At the reception offers coffee (1 EUR).

Reviews.Title: “Good location but rather basic.”
Reviews.Author: x-x-ECP-x-x
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly what we were looking for something nice, cheap and a good location. The hotel was basic but you get what you pay for and we only used it to sleep in, we were out the whole day. Although the hotel was basic, the staff were helpful and the rooms were cleaned everyday with sheets and towels changed. The roof area was nice in the evenings and we had a very large balcony that was good. The only down point with the room was there was no fridge which would of the nice.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Menalus
Reviews.Content: Bad points- It was hard to get a good nights sleep at this hotel as it was very hot in the rooms and loud throughout the night. Although it was in October, rome was still hot and the nights were no different. We were unable to sleep with the windows open as the noise from the street below was to much. I asked repetion to turn the A/C on and was told they do not turn them on at this time of year and if they were to turn them on it would cost 10euro's a night! The hotel was noisey at night, this was mosty due to other guests coming in drunk at 2.30am and screaming in the hallways. The thin walls, loud doors and leaky pipes all did not help. When we were sightseeing in rome, the days are very tiring and somewhere to get a good nights sleep is important too enjoying the trip. This hotel failed to deliever this so i wished i had spent alil more money on a better hotel and enjoyed the whole trip more. Good points- very clean and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Adriatic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tdvining
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Fabulous Fabio was a BIG help. He told us where to eat, what to go see and which bus to take to get there. Our room was great, the bed was a little hard but other than that it was a great location to see everything. I would highly recommend this hotel for the first time travelers, because it is within walking distance to the Vatican and other sites. Frank and Tina

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a no frills experience”
Reviews.Author: Hucks981
Reviews.Content: We did not have high expectations of this hotel but, sorry to say, I had hoped for a little more. On the plus side it was clean, the air con was effective and it was just 5 minutes walk from the Vatican City and only a few minutes more to Castel Sant'Angelo. But, our room was barely large enough for the bed and we couldn't open the wardobe door fully due to lack of space. The bathroom was also small with just enough room for the loo, basin and a small shower. We even had to take turns unpacking, dressing, undressing etc (and we are normal size). Apart from the bed there was a wardrobe with hanging rail, a table and a chair. No shelves or drawers to put t shirts or undies so they stayed in the suitcase. The street noise was too loud for uninterrupted sleep even with the window and metal shutters closed - and we live on a main road in the UK and are used to traffic noise at night. The neighbourhood is fine but if you want to experience Rome at night, you are too far away from a choice of good bars and restaurants. After spending all day walking around the wonderful sights, the last thing we wanted was a 30 minute walk to and from the centre of the city. This 2 star hotel is not bad if you want a very basic hotel but if you can find a few more Euros, make the most of your stay in Rome and find something better and more central.

Reviews.Title: “Super Value...Close to Vatican, bus stop, great restaurants...clean and secure”
Reviews.Author: cagoba25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because it was close to Vatican and cheap. Went with my younger brother, we had a nice room w/ two twin beds, clean bathroom. They keep the key when you leave, and you need to buzz in to get into the hotel. The rooftop patio is a nice relaxing place, but not really a good vantage point for any views. Some sides of the hotel could be noisy, but the rooms have motorized shutters that close down for darkening and noise reduction, which was nice. If you want a clean, no frills, cheap place to stay, this is the place for you. 5 minute walk to the 40 bus (express across town) and ~10 min leisurely walk to St Peter's. A street over, Borgo Pio, go to Restuchico (spelling?) restaurant for amazing food from a chef/owner and his wife...mixed in with some more touristy restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: DougalR
Reviews.Content: Perfect - central location, friendly and helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms. Couldn't wish for better value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Clean & Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: imjilyan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simple, but worked out very well! It was basic & no frills, but had A/C, free internet was a great location (right near the vatican & bus routes). The staff was kind of mediocre, but we didn't really need anything so it didn't matter. There was an adorable solarioum on the roof with nice lounge chairs & flowers, so that was a good treat - sitting out & relaxing with bread, cheese, loves & a nice breeze. Really a simply & good stay that was worth the $. We paid E100 (euro) a nite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Florence054
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of the price and the good reviews. Rome is a large city so some of the major attractions were some distance away but the hotel staff gave useful information about the local buses which were 1 euro for a single trip. Lots of cheap restaurants nearby. The weather was very hot so we paid the extra for air conditioning - hotel is on a very noisy road so it wasn't possible to have the window open. Bathroom fairly small but more than adequate. Would definitely recommend for a short budget stay.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise during our trip in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Easygoing47
Reviews.Content: I booked up this hotel back in March 2010 based on other reviewer's comments. I was not disappointed at all. Our triple room was of a decent size with comfortable beds, nice furniture, a state-of-the-art clean bathroom and a balcony. We also had access to a nice terrace on the hotel's roof. What else do you need? Nice hotel staff ? We had that too! They helped us with our luggage when we checked in and took care of the taxi reservation to go back to the airport. All this for $160 Euros per day during the high season. In my view, this is the perfect hotel for a short trip in Rome. The hotel is located 300 meters away from St. Peter, 200 meters away from castle San Angelo, 100 meters away from a pedestrian street full of restaurants and 300 meters away from a fancy commercial street where you can basically find everything. I'd go back there anytime!

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but clean, in a great location, and at a great price”
Reviews.Author: SteveZS
Reviews.Content: The room was adequate for our needs. The hotel staff was courteous, helpful and responsive (a light was flickering annoyingly in the bathroom - they fixed it immediately). Location was EXCELLENT - right in the midst of the romantic streets you see in the movies. No frills, no mirror in the bedroom, the wardrobe closet was broken but usable. But the price was great, the location was superb, and the staff was friendly and available.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price - no internet in room.”
Reviews.Author: Karen9999999
Reviews.Content: Just back from 10 days in Rome. The Hotel Adriatic staff was very nice and friendly and spoke English. The room was clean and an okay size. Very small tv, but that is to be expected in Rome. The bathroom was okay size, small shower. The shower was hard to keep a constant reasonable temperature. The location was good, although depending on where you plan to go in Rome a hotel a little closer to a popular piazza maybe better. The wifi does not work in the rooms. The only place the wifi works in in the hotel lobby. So if you need to use wifi plan to sit on the one loveseat in the lobby/front desk area.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: KentTammy
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay at this hotel and found although the rooms are a bit on the small side there is everything you need for a short break. The staff on reception were always very friendly and helpful. There is some street noise but if you use the shutter it is not too bad. We used the metro to get around but ended up walking a lot of the time as the different attractions are not that far apart.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: raoul88
Reviews.Content: Paid 55 euro by taxi for 3 pax with luggage which i think was a bit high from the airport to the hotel...The area and the hotel itself was very nice . Close to the Vatican and a couple of restaurants nearby, esply the Pizza restaurant around the corner ( pizza only in the evening). 10 euro to termini and 8 euro to the Spanish steps by Taxi. Metro is a 10 min walk. No safe in the rooms, but hotel has good security . Spacious Room for 3 adults. A bit Noisy at Night if the windows are open....good budget hotel for the price

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: goanjock
Reviews.Content: spotless and in a great location for exploring a wonderful city. Literally just a 5 minute walk from the Vatican as well as within walking distance of the rest of the "must see's" in Rome. Although there is no restaurant in the hotel there are a couple of lovely bakers just across the road and the roof-top garden a lovely spot to bring your breakfast back to. There are also some lovely restaurants within a 5 minute walk. Another great thing is you can catch a bus from Termini which will take you to within a 100 yards of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Michelle71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days at the end of March. I do not understand why this hotel is only 2 stars. The room we had was huge (79), the beds good and the whole place was spotless, I have stayed at hotels rated 4 stars that wasn't as nice as this place. There's a small TV, no fridge, but all things I can survive without whilst on a short trip to Rome. The staff are really friendly and we asked for a recommendation on somehwere to eat, the place they sent us to had great food. It's two minutes walk to St Peter's Square, a leisurely walk to many other main sites, many different supermarkets around the area. I didn't use public transport, just walked to most places with the aid of the map they have in the reception area. Definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Adriatic”
Reviews.Author: Eliyahoo
Reviews.Content: The Adriatic is in a great locatin just a few minutes a way from the vatican and spitting distance from the Piazza Novana. The rooms were very clean. The service at the front desk was amaizing, very friendly with great english. There is no restaurant for breakfast in the morning, and it could be slightly noisey if you had the window open but on the whole it was lovely and i wouldn't hesitate to go back! The BEST PART of it is the fact I got an amaizing deal in an unknown website called easy click travel (easyclicktravel.com). I think they have exclusive deal or something like that, this is the only reason I can think of why they were so cheap. Over all, with wining pricing and location it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic”
Reviews.Author: goldigol
Reviews.Content: It was truly lovely staying in Adriatic Hotel. The atmosphere was very cheerful and the service was very kind. The hotel is designed in a typical Italian city old style which I personally really like. The view seen from our room was a fantastic view of the city- it was very romantic yet not at all expensive. We paid through easy click travel web site only 70$ a night. It's not easy to find such a lovely room in Rome and for that price…Our room had internet access, air condition, TV with cables and other facilities. We highly recommend it and we'll surely come back to stay there next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically central, clean room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Rachaelk2004
Reviews.Content: Arrived late as our flight was delayed. No problems - staff extremely polite and helpful. Location was as described, literally two minutes walk to the Vatican. Great views from the fourth flour balconies. The room was exactly as described and exactly as pictured on their website. Pros: close the sights, clean and tidy, don't have to take room key out with you. Cons: thin walls, no tea/coffee facilities (apart from in reception), could do with bigger (or more modern) TV and a few more English channels. Overall, couldn't fault the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Star_1209
Reviews.Content: The Adriatic is in a great locatin just a stones throw from the vatican and 15 min walk into the Piazza Novana. The rooms were clean and serviced regularly. The guys at the front desk were lovely, very helpful and friendly with good english. There is a nice little sun terrace and drinks are sold at the reception. Slight draw back that there is no restaurant for breakfast in the morning, and it could be slightly noisey if you had the window open but on the whole it was lovely and i wouldn't hesitate to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location -- can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Jenni_K_NJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights earlier this September. We couldn't have asked for better service! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, the room was large, clean, and comfortable (#46, a corner room with 2 balconies!) and the location couldn't be better. We walked everywhere with no problems! We felt very safe in the hotel and walking at night in the area. The next time we are in Rome we will definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but pricy location.”
Reviews.Author: bech-lykke
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very easy to reach, we did metro and train, no problems - just be sure to have the train-tickets stamped before getting on the train (some tickets don´t need to, ask!)- people were fined 50 euro. Friendly staff, although they didn´t communicate - even after we had cancelled the A/C option after 1 night, we had to pay for 2, even trying to get full pay (70 euro) but i guess that´s what happens in Rome. People can be quite rude, especially during summer. The street is very noisy as a hospital is located nearby, on the opposite it´s very pleasant to hear the basilica´s bell every 15 min. Rooms are absolutely clean but very basic, wouldn´t recommend the nearby supermarket or the "breakfast - option" across the street. We went to "COIN" on a nearby major road for water etc. We stayed for 7 days and visited all the major sights by foot, wouldn´t recommend car - parking is herrendous. Absolutely safe neighbourhood

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: royle10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adriatic for 5 nights at the end of July, we cannot fault the hotel it was very nice. The room was very basic and small but it had a lovely bathroom which seemed fairly new. The Hotel is very secure and on a night the main doors are locked so you have to ring a bell to get in. The location is perfect we walked to many of the sites and a few times we used the Metro which was a very quick and easy way of getting around. I would definitely stay at this hotel again we had a lovely hoiliday, weather was fantastic, Rome was amazing !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: S_Pi_09
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the proximity to the Vatican. Area is nice, seemed safe even when we walked around at night. No breakfast served, so we had to find food outside. The concierge was a bit wierd - since he asked us to leave our passports with him overnight when we checked in (since he had to fill up the info sheet with our details). Also, no help was even offered in moving our bags. The rooms have dark blinds, so it gets very dark inside. However, all in all - this is a good hotel to stay especially since you are so close to the Vatican and a short walk from Ottaviano metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Montale
Reviews.Content: Even if a little expensive, the location is wonderful! Safe, clean and polite concierge. Easy to find as well!

Reviews.Title: “perfect short-stay hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SamUK84
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights in Rome, stayed at the Adriatic. This hotel is ideal if you're staying for a couple of days and want to save your money for seeing Rome. Great location (5mins walk to the Vatican) lots of bars and restaurants nearby. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room, although terribly decorated (horrible green wallpaper), was very clean, and the cleaners made sure we had clean towels and sheets each day. . There is no restaurant in the hotel however there is a small supermarket just down the road which sells fresh bread, fruit etc and the hotel has a lovely garden terrace which is great for eating your brekafast on (its also open all night) We got the Metro from Termini to Ottaviano and walked to the hotel from here (about 10 mins walk), although get directions to the hotel from the Metro stop before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have chosen a better hotel, location, cleanliness, price and roof garden!”
Reviews.Author: MariaScot
Reviews.Content: July 2009 and just returned from our first visit to Rome.....amazing! We were delighted with the Hotel Adriatic which was clean with friendly and helpful staff, but more importantly we felt safe and secure. Door entry system after 11.00pm and CCTV. Mintues away from the basilica of St Peter's and from our window we could see the side of the Castel Sant'Angelo... wonderful! We used the roof garden (4th floor) to chill out a bit before and after our very long walks, lovely! Good food from corner trattoria and an excellent cafe which are both just across the road. Hotel staff kindly kept our luggage until we were ready to leave! We used the express airport bus to Termini, then a No. 40 bus to San Pietro. The hotel is just a couple of minutes away, so no need to spend £50 on a taxi!

Reviews.Title: “Good for weekend but not for week or longer”
Reviews.Author: anonymous1983
Reviews.Content: Adriatic is in a great location in terms of it being very close to vatican (one road away) and all parts of town are easily accessible by foot OR bus OR taxi. The reception staff are lovely and friendly and were always very helpful with directions etc. The Room (No. 60): The bedroom we had was very large with a double bed - it had a large window and a very TINY bathroom. the shower was literally spraying water down onto the loo etc. we had no balcony and no amenities. From looking at others photos of different rooms it is clear that most have been renovated - but not ours. If you are staying for longer than a long weekend then request a room with balcony etc and one away from the main road. A lot of cars go down the road from the square and it was quite noisy. As we visited in march and were out all day we did not use the roof top terrace or elevator. I did however notice a supermarket and cafe nearby where you cud but brekky to eat up there :) Overall i wud definitely recommend it for a weekend break - but i cannot give it higher than 3 stars due to lack of amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: Gail B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adriatic a couple of years ago and so enjoyed our experience, we did not think of staying anywhere else on our return to Rome. The location is ideal - within walking distance of most places and near the 40 Busstop which takes you to the Terminus/Rail station. The staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful. Although this is a two star hotel, we have stayed in much worse three star hotels. The room we had was small this time unlike the large room we had last time but it was clean and had a pleasant view. A light above the sink in the bathroom did not work but this was sorted when we showed the chambermaid - she immediately summoned a workman - even though she did not speak any English and our Italian is virtually non-existent. The roof top terrace on the fourth floor is lovely. We found the room only accommodation really suited us - don't have to get up at any particular time to make it for breakfast and it is good to stop at a café and watch the world go by drinking a coffee or chocolate with a pastry. If - no - when - we return to Rome we shall definitely stay at the Adriatic again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chillardo
Reviews.Content: We booked two triple rooms for 6 people (including 4 teens). When we first booked, we were thinking of three things - air conditioning, location and value. We chose the Adriatic over a less expensive hotel, and found that an extra 10-15 Euros per night bought that air conditioning and terrific location at the Adriatic. We couldn't believe our luck (using Trip Advisor reviews) in finding a two-star so close to the Vatican, etc. Wow. The hotel itself is okay. Clean, efficient staff, etc. There's a very nice rooftop area for fresh air - no drink service or anything, but very pleasant. The staff members are indifferent, but not intimidating. Our only negative encounter came when we asked a desk person where we could find the hop-on-hop-off bus and/or buy tickets for it. He simply said, "We don't work with them." I was surprised he didn't try to offer directions as a courtesy. But that was that. As it turns out, the buses (several companies) can be found outside St. Peter's, which is a short walk. Of all the hotels we stayed at in Europe - or anywhere - the Adriatic had very few brochures or maps that would be helpful to tourists. It wasn't a big deal to make our own way and find things on our own. We don't sweat that kind of thing, but I'll admit we were a little frustrated because we had very little time in Rome and didn't want to waste time searching. It all turned out okay though. Otherwise, the experience was a good one and I wouldn't hesitate to stay again (and again) since the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Adriatic is ok, cheap, central and clean. Good Option for low budget”
Reviews.Author: GPCOSTA
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here in November 2006 while my girlfriend was living in Rome. I was visiting her and caught a flight to Rome without any previous hotel booking. Hotels in Rome are extremely expensive, be aware. The cheaper ones are very difficult to find, all busy. First time i was in Rome visiting my girlfriend i stayed at Cascina Palace, which is very far from the city and very bad! This one (Adriatic) is a very good place to sleep in Rome, very central, and clean. Don't expect a luxury hotel, you won't find it here. If you have small budget and want to something just to sleep in Rome, Adriatic is the right place for you, just near Vatican. I think i paid something like 30 euro per night, which is almost for free in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “better than a 2 star!”
Reviews.Author: audreyYorkshire
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 nights in february 2008 and found the location of the hotel excellent,very near the vatican and easy access by bus. The staff were all pleasant and very helpful. The room and en suite was modern and cleaned daily. Because of its location it can be noisy at night ,but I would still return again to this hotel . There is no breakfast or drinks provided so my only suggestion would be take a travel kettle.

Reviews.Title: “Adriatic is good”
Reviews.Author: Slavabo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Adriatic for 6 nights in October,hotel was clean,staff was very friendly and helpful.Bathroom was pretty small , but clean and renewed.Location! Location is fantastic , about 5 min walk to Vatican,5 min to St Angelo castle,20 min to piazza Navona.There is a little supermarket near the hotel - good prices.Want to recommend the cafe shop across the street (on the corner) - good cappuchino and not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Forgotten how many times I've stayed”
Reviews.Author: Longarm76
Reviews.Content: I must have stayed here at least once a year for the last 3-4 years! You can't fault it's location, right next to Vatican. Short walk will get get you into main tourist areas of Rome. I have used this for weekend getaways also for watching rugby internationals. Front desk will organise anything for you, great for storage of luggage allowing your last day to be used to the max. No place to eat but cafe etc across the street and if you can't find a nice place to eat in Rome you shouldn't be travelling!!! Only issue mayby the number of steps but the lift now does work, I have sent many friends and never had a bad word said about it. Go and enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Adraitic visit number 2”
Reviews.Author: Sam75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Adriatic for the second time in March 07 (initial stay was July 06) and it was just as good as I remembered. The room was on a completely different floor, but was just as large, with a bath and over shower. The only down point was that the bathroom could have done with a re-paint. However the staff were just as friendly as I remembered and everything just as close. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Comfortable Hotel Great Value”
Reviews.Author: theharrisons04
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on last.minute.com. Was a little wary as got a really great price. No need to have worried, this hotel was comfortable, just a room but clean and in a fantastic location. It was really close to all the main attractions and the metro. The vatican is literally just 5 mins walk. Catsle angelo 5 mins the other way. We were hardly in the room as there was so much to do so nothing more than comfortable was necessary. Would definately go back any day was perfect for a weekend city break. Snap this one up if you come accross it

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - Good, Basic, Friendly, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simwin
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for a 5 day city break in October 2006. Fantastic location. We were able to walk to all of the major tourist attractions from here (all within a 2.5 mile radius) Facilities were basic but very clean and I would have no hesitation in recommending this Hotel. Top tip - bring travel kettle tea/coffee. You can walk to this Hotel from the train/tube. Easy to find. I would however also recommend ear plugs as it can be a bit noisy with traffic below.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, good location ...”
Reviews.Author: TabithaNYC
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a lovely break in Rome, don't know if anyone else has found this recently, but we were eaten alive by mosquito's ...in December*!!! Stayed at the Hotel Adriatic and while it was very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful, we did think it was a little outdated and dark despite the website stating it was renovated in 2004. The wallpaper was peeling off in our room (No 61) and the carpet was a bit grubby but the huge bed was clean and comfortable. We did get this room for 3 nights for a bargain price though, so wouldn't complain too much. It is ideally situated for the Vatican City and there are some really nice restaurants nearby. If visiting the Vatican Museums (Superb!) we'd recommend you don't visit the cafe directly opposite the exit ... they charge a *fortune* for snacks and drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Adriatic Is Just Right”
Reviews.Author: krock213
Reviews.Content: Was able to stay at the Adriatic while on vacation in Italy a few years ago. It is in a great location. Bus stop very close by. Tour buses come to the front door. It was clean and everything you need to stay within a budget and be pleased. Nothing over the top.....but if I were going back, that is exactly where I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base”
Reviews.Author: I-Bod
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Hotel Adriatic on July 14th 2006 and stayed for four nights. My Mum and I had the best holiday ever in Rome. The Hotel room we were in (No. 68) was quite small but perfect as a base. It was very clean and we had air conditioning which I'd say is essential for a July trip to Rome. The (huge) bed was very comfortable and clean, towels were changed when we left the used ones on the floor and although the shower room was more of a wet room and had a few chips out of the tiles it was clean, the shower was very powerful and we never had problems getting loads of piping hot water (although cool showers were the order of the day as it was 34 degrees while we were there). The location of the Hotel is ideal, very close (less than 5 minutes walk) to St Peters Square and Vatican City and also within easy reach of the Ottaviano Metro Station which we used frequently to get around, most of the main attractions are within easy reach of a Metro stop. Watch your bag/wallet on the Metro though, pickpockets are rife and will pull all sorts of stunts to distract you from your valuables! Be alert and you'll be fine, we felt safe using it through the day and early evening. Don't know if we'd have used it at night though. Only other comment would be the lack of a decent mirror in the room. I'd definately stay here again but I'd be taking a mirror for doing make-up/hair etc with me.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place for weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: BeeB0
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed here for 3 nights in May. Although the decor was a little dated the room was very clean and the maids came in each morning to clean the room and replace the towels. We paid extra for air conditioning (10 Euros a night) but was worth it as the room got hot during the night and as the hotel was on a busy street it was too loud to have the windows open. We found the reception staff to be very friendly and would recommend this hotel for couples looking for a 'reasonable priced' weekend away. The location was also ideal for the Vatican (literally a 3 minute walk).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Cheri_Ja
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights. Great location near vatican city. Be sure to book room with air conditioning. On the 1st night we had a room with no a/c and felt unsafe to leave the backdoor open, which was the only way to ventilate the room. Horrible night. The second day a room became available. It was a world of difference. The room was newer, bigger, with better views, and air conditioning! Great 2 nights! The room top deck was nice as well. We got a bottle of wine and a pizza from close by stores and had low key, romantic night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Excellent, Safe Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We Loved this hotel, it is ideal for someone wanting a clean, safe and comfortable hotel. I travelled here with my boyfriend for 3 nights, we had absolutely no problems. Its in a nice, safe area, very close to everything (The Vatican city is just around the corner). The rooms are spotlessly clean but small, however, ideal for the job. We also had a balcony which we could sit on which was nice. Our bed clothes and towels etc were changed daily. Reception and staff are very friendly and helpful(not at all pushy or sleazy). All in all definitely worth the money, the location is excellent, we felt so safe, and had no problem sleeping at night as windows have shutters which practically block out all the noise.
